page.title: 04MARYKIRK SCHOOL SENIORS
page.content: The senior room runs a daily routine. We have 16 people in the classroom including the head teacher. There are 16 tables in the room, not including the teacher's table. Two of the tables are used for setting out tests and books. The school computer, a Sinclair Spectrum, is also kept in the Senior's room. In our room there are three classes - primary 5, primary 6 and primary 7. There are five pupils in each class. The school pet gerbils, Sweet and Sour, are looked after by the Seniors. Our visiting teachers for gym, art, music and home economics, come from Mearns Academy, the nearest secondary school. We travel there by mini bus for swimming lessons during the summer term. During the year the nurse, doctor, dentist and audiometrician visit the school to check the pupils' health.
